text: A simple tenement somewhere in the Bronx. A picture of He in his glory days hangs on a wall. Next to him, a beautif woman, holding on to his arm. He's her prize. She is PUCH the love of his life.

Never never leave you mami...it's not the same thing as being there with you...touching you, kissing you...bueno, I better stop...just wanted to tell you over and over I Love You...and I'm right here with you. See me? Happy birthday Puchi... (singing) Happy...

(to herself) ...never leave me? But you did. She stops the machine. But the pain doesn't stop.  2. She walks into frame. Stands next to the stereo...turns t volume up. She listens to the music...and for a moment do a little sway, tries a couple of steps, but it hurts and stops moving...that's all her broken heart can handle on special day. AN ABSTRACT BLUR FILLS THE SCREEN. RED COLORS...BRIGHT AS BLOOD...and TROPICAL BLUE, as the most beautiful ocean. The colors move...slowly coming int FOCUS.
bobs in the air. It's a CAP someone's wearing. A DIFFERENT STYLE OF MUSIC PLAYS LOUDLY... it rattles the street with bass and attitude. POUNDING RA TITLES BEGIN.

CITY ANIMAL in his street war uniform. he hip-hop MUSIC screaming out of an appliance store tell story of rough living and urban anarchy...and it makes th oung man wearing the cap feel like he OWNS LIFE. Now we see her clearly, as she catches her own reflection the store's mirrored panels...her face, lost amongst ever ELECTRONIC gadget imaginable... and the usual array of NY souvenirs. She stares at herself with the same curiosity she did when she watched the YOUNG MAN.
She likes what she sees. She looks worn and beautifully damaged...someone whose life took as hard as she gave...t EYES you own when you've SURVIVED every war you've create
Madison Square Garden...yeah there was a time. WE HEAR HE VOICE -- as she goes inside a much more unknown, forgotte and near condemned building on a side street.

He didn't know how much he had...never believed how much people loved him.  AN ON CAMERA INTERVIEW... Puchi is looking straight through us now. A CLOSE UP ON H FACE...a map of the whole doomed journey now finished.

He had it all...and he had me. She laughs...we hear the laughter. Yes...through that lau we can see there was a time when she had that walk and st and she OWNED LIFE HERSELF...and nothing was going to kno her out of the ring.

Puchi looks around the forsaken recording studio, where hundreds of hits were once recorded, now waits silent and empty. She's been here before. A piano sits in a corner crowned with empty cans of soda and dust. Congas ina corner...tipped sideways. A floor littered with maracas a musical instruments...and memories.

...for more than twenty years... A room that has seen better days. Puchi is facing a small crew of YOUNG Latin- music freaks...maybe french-hispanophiles. She smokes nervously trying to glamorize her last fifteen minutes in the spotl

NECKLACE, the name PUCHI is spell in diamonds.
Was it good love? Well, that's another story.. Puchi gives her devastating beauty a final look of approv then walks out, grabbing a MAN'S WHITE SUIT off the door hanger on the way.
Puchi quickly walks down A DILAPIDATED HALLWAY. Yesterday Gold records and artwork decorate the walls. She goes to another DOOR, opens it.

Disco music blares out of the room. A handsome Puerto-Ric man in his late thirties, is startled by her. His name is COOKIE. A combination of many tasks and no specific job. He grabs a jacket, checks his watch and prepares for an u mission.
Let's go.
Posters of bands on the wall. A teen-ager stares her down it's her son TITO. A handsome, defiant young man.
(to the kid) I don't wanna go out looking for you too when we come home, okay? The man-kid ignores her as best as he can.
as she closes her eyes, as if that one memory still BURNS

Love is never perfect when it's real love... The Limo turns the corner off Ave. D onto 9th Street and stops in front of a squatters TENEMENT BUILDING.

It was old fashioned love. It was good, it was bad, it was beautiful. Puchi struts in. Everyone freezes except the guy wearing the sunglasses, who waves...and smiles, unable to disguis the absurdity of playing dead with so much to live for It's Hector. Just a tad surprised.
Hi, honey...

Yeah...but I'm always high! Puchi pulls out a coke vial....as the Limo takes a fast t she ends up on top of him...and so does the coke. white powder all over his face. Puchi looks at her Hector, lick his cheek and mouth jokingly...she smiles proudly at the craziness of it all.

It's not his fault...it's yours...and you're my fault. But this is the last time he does this. He points his finger at RALPH, a stocky mulatto skinned balding man. Rican and slick. Ralph's on the phone. He listens, hangs up.
(grinning) Elvis is in the building.
People rush down a long corridor. The intro to "El Cantan is heard from the stage as our man walks down the corrido everyone slapping him on the back, like a boxer going int the ring.
Move! Move! Let the man through!
Hector enter stage, as casual as stepping into his living room. As he turns, he sees what awaits him: 20,000 fans cheering. They stand up for him as he shuffles to center stage.

(singing) Yo soy, Hector Lavoe and... (with a grin) I'm here! Thunderous APPLAUSE follows. The BAND goes into second ge as he continues to sing. Hector made it. HE TAKES A GLANCE OFF STAGE, TO THE WINGS, HE SEES PUCHI. He smiles at her. The world is his...tonight. He kicks into the first verse of : "El Cantante".

"Yo, soy el cantante..." THE FACES IN THE AUDIENCE: sheer adulation. (STOCK FOOTAG from those days) HECTOR spreads his arms to his thousands adoring fans. THE PUERTO RICAN FLAG spreads out in the balcony. The crowd CHEERS as the flag DANCES...a subtle but defining political PARTY, live from New York City.

The more he grew as an artist, the deeper he sank as a person, as a human being...but they loved him. All his faults and trouble....only made him more like one of them... THE MUSIC ECHOES AWAY... as the FLASHBACK ENDS. A POSTER FROM THAT DATE, HANGS ON WALL...the past is long gone, we're in...

loved him and was very supportive...his mother died when he was three...but he would talk about her as if she was still alive...he never accepted the fact that she was gone. Hector never had it hard...that was the problem. He made it hard for himself because it had all been too easy. She smiles, as if there was only one reason for everythin she does now days. (a sigh) He never goes away...maybe it's just my fucking guilt. We see PUCHI peeking through the glass inside the SOUND B It's like walking through the Titanic...death everywhere. No one will ever return to this musical tomb.

( a GIG with his father's band...) Back home in Puerto Rico, Hector and his father are singi a duet. Hector plays guitar. A BOLERO PLAYS...angels singing. It's a family reunion. A Spanish guitar and a beautiful song, Panchito Riset's " "Blancas Azucenas". A love story of lovers splitting when one of them leaves the island and goes to New York. (singing) ...aun guardo las dos blancas azucenas, que me diste hasta despedirte de mi..." Family is watching the magic moment. As the song ends in beautiful harmony of the two men...Hector hugs the old ma with a beautiful voice (CHEO FELICIANO)...with a smile on his face, as he sees Hector enjoying the cheers. The old man turns to Hector and without skipping a beat whispers...totally unexpectedly.

If you go to New York...just imagine I died. I already lost one son...and I am not going to lose another one. It will be you who loses a father ...understood? (to a woman nearby) Awilda, how'bout a beer for a loving man? He walks away. Leaving Hector shattered. No one around notices the exchange. Hector turns white. It's the nicest threat anyone ever said to him. Tonight it's his father just telling him 'how serious' a felony i would be for Hector to go north. He gets up himself and walks away from the stage, only the sounds of the COQUIS heard out there in the darkness... A BLAST OF NEW YORK CITY...
The old days in all it's splendor. Tad's Steak, Tie City, The Metropole Cafe, Automats, Theater lights, Penny Arcad etc. TIMES SQUARE in the sixties...a naive version of SIN (STOCK)
Hector's in heaven.

Just as a BAND BOY carries a Trombone case from a VAN ins the stage door, Hector strolls up. Mister Casual. He sees one of them. A young man we know, a younger, confident Cookie, way before LIFE had turned him into a punchy boxe that never fought a fight.
Hey, man, you need some help?
(looking around) Yeah...hurry up.  10. Cookie grabs a CONGA out of the back. Hector does the sam He follows the band boy in. Cookie winks an eye at Hector In and free.

A Tropical paradise in the asphalt jungle. The dance floor packed with beautiful, young NUYORICANS dancing to live Salsa music. LARRY HARLOW, a hot new band plays their asses off. Hector notices a stunningly beauti woman dancing by herself on the dance floor...as if danci with each member of the band and busy with every guy in t house. It's Puchi. Younger but never too innocent. Hector sees her, like his dream...a vision he has to look away from, cause she can't be real. Puchi only sees a gee looking guy drooling like he should.

So did I...aren't you? They both laugh. A hopped up cat wearing a silver shark skin suit spots Co It's PAPO, he happens to be Puchi's hoodlum brother. He flashes a gold tooth smile of a warning at Hector...who i hypnotized by the Music and the Scene.
Salsa?

That's what they call it here in New York. Salsa...it's a mix of Mambo, Bomba, Son...Charanga. It's like a revolution cooking, bro. Everybody is into it. Welcome to New York Bro! Hector nods...yes, this is better than what he always dre of HECTOR WAKES UP...as a woman screams:
Hector wake up!!!
Linoleum, and plastic covered seats. He bolts out of his dream. His sister PRISCILLA, standing by the sofa where h sleeps.  11.
I'm giving you two more weeks, you hear me? Hector nods.
Two weeks to get a job or you go back to Puerto Rico. You understand?
What did I do? Wha'happened?
I'm serious. I don't want dad to disown me too. Okay? Hector sits up. Confronts her as much as you can when you only wearing baggy shorts and a pajama top.

I'm here to be a singer Priscilla, not to prove my father wrong. I'll have a job so fast, you wont even know I have a job. You'll be asking "where is he?...where is he...?'. And me...? You'll see. A SUBWAY RATTLES BY...
A seedy looking storefront underneath the train in a 125t Street. They walk inside the old nightclub.
Look, these are my friends. The subways rattles by. Hector looks up, startled.
I better get a job or I'm flying back on Eastern Airlines...you told them about me? Hector belts out a couple of lines from a song.
Shit, man...you gotta good voice. This is the best time for you to be in New York. But don't get any ideas. They already have a singer. Just enjoy the show, man.

The place is half-empty, a sextet is playing, vamping int song and without a singer.  12. The musicians look a little nervous as they look around f their vocalist. The band is playing "Tus Ojos". A fidgety Hector is stand nearby...singing the song to himself, but loud enough to heard. The leader of the band sees Cookie, who points to Hector...implying 'he can do it...he can fill in'. The gu waves him over.
Hector...mira man...
I know that song better than anyone here tonight.
You better. It's now or never panita. Hector does the sign of the cross as he makes his way thr the crowd as the leader heats up the band and introduced Hector.
You're ready out there for a surprise? Cookie wants to die, as Hector walks up to the stage to s the world. The band starts it up and all it takes is one minute for Hector to own the song.
Okay...okay. (confident) Como esta mi gente esta noche...esperandome, right? I'm here. Hector stays on the stage and steals the show.
Puchi plays with a gold chain she's wearing. Tries not to look at the Camera in front of her

...that's how we say in Spanish when you're blessed...you know...some people struggle for years...not him...it's like he always knew it was going to happen...that he'd make it... (the gold cross in between her fingers) This is his... That first time I saw him, he was the most ridiculous guy in the place...but the only one (MORE )
who brought me a present...he didn't even know me...but he had manners that old fashioned thing...I loved that. (to camera) You know, it's my birthday today?
Happy birthday. A JOE CUBA BOOGALOO blasts. The MUSIC is coming from...

Like a garden for Puerto-Ricans. The city lights in the back as the sun goes down. All the money in the world couldn't buy you this. A Boogaloo line is on full swing. It's dirty dancing a lo dirtier. Hot Nuyorican beauties. Hector has stepped in th new West Side Story, dressed in a 100% polyester. Hello there...happy happy birthday...sorry I didn't remember your name... Puchi stares at Hector, the look you give a big square hi fresh off the island.  14.

(Mexican accent) That's right... He manages a little smile from her

That's all I need to sing my best...a good pair of... (eyeing her) ...ears.  15.

Okay. (takes it) Thank you. Papo walks away.  16. Hector studies the joint. First joint in his life. He tak a drag and blows it right out. Puchi looks on.
Not like a cigarette, man... (surprised) you've never smoked have you...? Hector fears what to say next, he'll do whatever he's got do to keep her next to him.
Mira...watch me... (without a joint) ...look, you're supposed to hold it inside. She mimics a smoking lesson specially for Hector. It's al a sexual act. Hector watches fascinated.
